results.content: Above and beyond, also gives design tips for best practices and how to use css with JavaScript.  Excellent course.  Be sure to change movie speed to meet your learning style.
results.content_html: Above and beyond, also gives design tips for best practices and how to use css with JavaScript. Excellent course. Be sure to change movie speed to meet your learning style.

results.content: If you really want to unlock the power of all those weird looking selectors you may have been ignoring, this is definitely the course for you -- it's in depth, and concise. (BTW, his CSS Shapes course is also awesome!!!! Check it out! :-) ). Rahul has an amazing depth of knowledge he shares with his students. I have been using CSS for over 20 years, and this is the first time I've actually seen someone provide GOOD examples of these advanced CSS selectors which I have never felt I had need of. I now understand their power and will use them -- especially as he indicates there are times when you absolutely CAN NOT add your own ids and classes, or access element selectors, such as in WordPress or other CMS's.BTW, the only difficulty with this course is Rahul's pace -- but I found watching it at 3/4 speed did the trick for me.  Cheers Rahul!! Keep it up!

response.content: Hey, Tami for this juicy review man, really appreciate it and I'll try to slow down my self on my future courses :)
response.content_html: Hey, Tami for this juicy review man, really appreciate it and I'll try to slow down my self on my future courses :)

results.content: Great teacher, direct to the point. Short videos but all info is valuable. Recommended.

results.content: Well I had previous css knowledge even though I always used to struggle with Pseudo classes and how to use it confidently . I just picked this course randomly but it turned out to be an awesome course for me. It has given me confidence and simultaneously cleared all my confusion over Pseudo classes.  Further, I would say, if you could also add some lessons on how to add Font Awesome icons via  pseudo elements then it would be an ideal course especially for beginners. Since I was aware of it so it does not bother me. I would 100% recommend this course especially to beginners as well as to those who struggled with Pseudo classes or Pseudo elements. Thank You Rahul for creating this course. The best part is that you replied all my queries except one which is excusable.  ALL THE BEST!

response.content:
Thank you so much for the review, Arshad. Really appreciate it.

And yeah within a week or so I'll add a video on "how to add font awesome icons via pseudo-elements" as you suggested, it's on my queue now.

Again thank you for being here :)
